Package game

Class GameStuff

java.lang.Object
game.GameStuff
public class GameStuff extends Object
The GameStuff class encapsulates various functionalities for game management, such as score calculation, saving/loading game states, and restarting levels.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameStuff

      public GameStuff()

  • Method Details

    • scoreCalc

      public void scoreCalc(int timeLeft, int chipsTaken)
      Calculates the score based on the time left and the number of chips collected. The method can be expanded to include functionality for appending the score to a highscore table.
      Parameters:
      timeLeft - The remaining time in the game.
      chipsTaken - The number of chips collected.

    • saveGame

      public static void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state to a file. This method writes a representation of the game state to a file for later retrieval.

    • loadGame

      public static void loadGame()
      Loads a game state from a file. This method reads the game state from a file and processes it to restore the game.

    • restartLevel

      public void restartLevel()
      Restarts the current level. This method reloads the game, assuming the level file does not change.

    • Start

      public void Start()
      Starts the level. This method is intended to initialize and start a level, requiring data from the Level class and other game components.
